qas.question: What are Bell's personal papers known as?
In what part of the Library of Congress are Bell's papers kept?
Apart from in person, how can one look at many of Bell's papers?
In what university is the Alexander Graham Bell Institute?
In what province is the Alexander Graham Bell Institute located?

context: A large number of Bell's writings, personal correspondence, notebooks, papers and other documents reside at both the United States Library of Congress <a1_0>Manuscript Division<a1_0/> (as the <a0_0>Alexander Graham Bell Family Papers<a0_0/>), and at the Alexander Graham Bell Institute, <a3_0>Cape Breton University<a3_0/>, <a4_0>Nova Scotia<a4_0/>; major portions of which are available for <a2_0>online<a2_0/> viewing.
